transcript.text: What would you do if someone sent you personal data you weren’t supposed to see?

contentText.text: You’ve been tasked with notifying contractors of a new billing process.

You ask an employee in another department to send you the list of email addresses but the spreadsheet he sends you also includes personal information used to secure their account, such as birth date, mother’s name and Social Security number.

instructionText.text: Select one option and then submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

optionContent.option: Delete the email and report to the Data Privacy Team by emailing privacy@jci.com
Forward it to your colleagues at work as an example of what not to send by email
Take only what you need from the spreadsheet and securely dispose of the rest
Email all of the contractors to tell them their personal data may have been exposed

correct.text: Data privacy laws, and the Johnson Controls data privacy policy, apply to the personal information of employees as well as customers and business partners. Make sure you understand your responsibilities and follow Johnson Controls’ privacy policy and all relevant data protection and privacy laws.
